data.enText: used like a preposition, followed by a noun, pronoun or number, or by the -ing form of a verb
data.chText: 用法同介词，后接名词、代词、数字或动词的-ing形式

data.enText: having a value in money, etc.
data.chText: 有…价值；值…钱

data.enText: Our house is worth about £100 000.
data.chText: 我们的房子大约值10万英镑。

data.enText: How much is this painting worth?
data.chText: 这幅画值多少钱？

data.enText: to be worth a bomb/packet/fortune (= a lot of money)
data.chText: 值一大笔钱

data.enText: It isn't worth much.
data.chText: 这不值多少钱。

data.enText: If you answer this question correctly, it's worth five points.
data.chText: 答对了这道题可以得五分。

data.enText: used to recommend the action mentioned because you think it may be useful, enjoyable, etc.
data.chText: （指行动）值得，有价值

data.enText: The museum is certainly worth a visit.
data.chText: 这家博物馆的确值得参观。

data.enText: This idea is well worth considering.
data.chText: 这个想法很值得考虑。

data.enText: It's worth making an appointment before you go.
data.chText: 去之前预约一下是值得的。

data.enText: important, good or enjoyable enough to make sb feel satisfied, especially when difficulty or effort is involved
data.chText: 值得（费周折）

data.enText: Was it worth the effort?
data.chText: 这值得花费力气吗？

data.enText: The new house really wasn't worth all the expense involved.
data.chText: 这座新房子确实不值这么多的花费。

data.enText: The job involves a lot of hard work but it's worth it .
data.chText: 这工作需要花费很大力气，但是值得。

data.enText: The trip was expensive but it was worth every penny .
data.chText: 这次旅行花费很大，但是花的每一分钱都不冤枉。

data.enText: having money and possessions of a particular value
data.chText: 拥有…价值的财产

data.enText: He's worth £10 million.
data.chText: 他拥有1 000万英镑的财产。

data.enText: for all sb/it is worth
with great energy, effort and determination
data.chText: 竭尽全力；拼命；十分坚定

data.enText: He was rowing for all he was worth.
data.chText: 他在拼命地划船。

data.enText: in order to get as much as you can from sb/sth
data.chText: 尽量（多得）；拼命（榨取）

data.enText: She is milking her success for all it's worth.
data.chText: 她在利用自己成功的机会拼命捞好处。

data.enText: for what it's worth
used to emphasize that what you are saying is only your own opinion or suggestion and may not be very helpful
data.chText: （所说的只是个人意见）无论管不管用，不论好坏

data.enText: I prefer this colour, for what it's worth.
data.chText: 无论好坏，我喜欢这个颜色。

data.enText: (the game is) not worth the candle
the advantages to be gained from doing sth are not great enough, considering the effort or cost involved
data.chText: 得不偿失；代价太高

data.enText: not worth the paper it's written/printed on
having no value, especially legally, or because one of the people involved has no intention of doing what they said they would
data.chText: （尤指在法律上）毫无价值

before.enText: of an agreement or official document

data.enText: worth your/its salt
deserving respect, especially because you do your job well
data.chText: 称职；胜任

data.enText: Any teacher worth her salt knows that.
data.chText: 凡称职的教师都知道这一点。

data.enText: worth your/its weight in gold
very useful or valuable
data.chText: 非常有用；很有价值

data.enText: A good mechanic is worth his weight in gold.
data.chText: 一位优秀的技工是不可多得的。

data.enText: worth sb's while
interesting or useful for sb to do
data.chText: 对…有好处（或用处）；值得

data.enText: It will be worth your while to come to the meeting.
data.chText: 你来参加会议对你会大有好处。

data.enText: He'll do the job if you make it worth his while (= pay him well) .
data.chText: 你要是给他的报酬丰厚，他会做这份工作的。

data.enText: a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush
it is better to keep sth that you already have than to risk losing it by trying to get much more
data.chText: 一鸟在手胜过双鸟在林（满足于现有的总比因过分追求而失去一切好）

data.enText: more than your job's worth (to do sth)
not worth doing because it is against the rules or because it might cause you to lose your job
data.chText: 工作所不允许的事；违反原则的事；可能丢饭碗的事

data.enText: It's more than my job's worth to let you in without a ticket.
data.chText: 没有票就让你进去，我可能会丢饭碗的。

data.enText: an amount of sth that has the value mentioned
data.chText: 价值（十元、40英镑等）的东西

data.enText: The winner will receive ten pounds' worth of books.
data.chText: 获胜者将得到价值十英镑的书籍。

data.enText: a dollar's worth of change
data.chText: 一元的零钱

texts: a week's, month's, etc. ~ of sth

data.enText: an amount of sth that lasts a week, etc.
data.chText: 能用（一个星期、一个月等）的东西

data.enText: the financial, practical or moral value of sb/sth
data.chText: 价值；意义；作用

data.enText: Their contribution was of great worth.
data.chText: 他们的贡献具有伟大的意义。

data.enText: The activities help children to develop a sense of their own worth.
data.chText: 这些活动有助于儿童培养自身的价值感。

data.enText: A good interview enables candidates to prove their worth (= show how good they are) .
data.chText: 好的面试可以让求职者证明他们的价值。

data.enText: a personal net worth of $10 million
data.chText: 价值1 000万元的个人净资产

data.enText: put in your two cents' worth

data.text: = put in your two pennyworth at pennyworth

data.enText: get your money's worth
to get enough value or enjoyment out of sth, considering the amount of money, time, etc. that you are spending on it
data.chText: （钱或时间等）值得花

data.enText: These words all refer to the amount of money that you have to pay for sth.
data.chText: 以上各词均指价值、价钱。

data.enText: price
the amount of money that you have to pay for an item or service
data.chText: 指商品或服务的价格、价钱：

data.enText: house prices
data.chText: 房屋价格

data.enText: How much are these? They don't have a price on them.
data.chText: 这些东西卖多少钱？它们都没有标价。

data.enText: I can't afford it at that price .
data.chText: 这样的价格我付不起。

data.enText: cost
the amount of money that you need in order to buy, make or do sth
data.chText: 指购买、制造某物或做某事所需的成本、费用、花费：

data.enText: A new computer system has been installed at a cost of £80 000.
data.chText: 新的计算机系统已安装，费用为8万英镑。

data.enText: value
how much sth is worth in money or other goods for which it can be exchanged
data.chText: 指价值：

data.enText: The winner will receive a prize to the value of £1 000.
data.chText: 获胜者将得到价值为1 000英镑的奖品。

data.enText: Especially in British English, value can also mean how much sth is worth compared with its price.
data.chText: 尤其在英国英语中，value亦含与其价格相比的值、划算程度：

data.enText: This restaurant is excellent value (= is worth the money it costs) .
data.chText: 这家餐馆很合算。

data.enText: price, cost or value?
data.chText: 用price、cost还是value？

data.enText: The price is what sb asks you to pay for an item or service.
data.chText: price指商品或服务的要价：

data.enText: to ask/charge a high price
data.chText: 要价／收费高

data.enText: to ask/charge a high cost/value
Obtaining or achieving sth may have a cost ; the value of sth is how much other people would be willing to pay for it.
data.chText: cost指获取某物或达到某目的所需的费用；value指别人愿意为某物付出的值：

data.enText: house prices
data.chText: 房屋价格

data.enText: the cost of moving house
data.chText: 搬家费用

data.enText: The house now has a market value of one million pounds.
data.chText: 这栋房子目前的市场价值为100万英镑。

data.enText: expense
the money that you spend on sth; sth that makes you spend money
data.chText: 指所花费用、花钱的东西、开销：

data.enText: The garden was transformed at great expense .
data.chText: 花园改建花了一大笔费用。

data.enText: Running a car is a big expense.
data.chText: 养一辆车开销很大。

data.enText: worth
the financial value of sb/sth
data.chText: 指人或物的价值：

data.enText: He has a personal net worth of $10 million.
data.chText: 他有价值1千万元的个人净资产。

data.enText: Worth is more often used to mean the practical or moral value of sth.
data.chText: worth较常用以指某事物的实际作用或道德意义。

data.enText: the high price/cost/value/expense of sth
the real/true price/cost/value/expense/worth of sth
to put/set a price/value on sth
to lower/reduce/cut the price/cost/value/expense of sth
to increase/raise the price/cost/value/expense of sth
to drop/fall/go down in price/value
to go up/increase/rise in price/value

word_means: 价值(十元、40英镑等)的东西

means: 价值(十元、40英镑等)的东西
能用(一个星期、一个月等)的东西

ex.enText: This painting is probably worth thousands of pounds.
ex.chText: 这幅画可能价值数千英镑。

ex.enText: This book is definitely worth reading.
It was a difficult journey, but it was worth it.
ex.chText: 这次旅行很艰苦，但很值得。

synonyms.bx: 具有介词性质的表语形容词，通常用在动词 to be 之后，其后应接名词、代词（宾格）、数词或主动形式的动名词。

ex.enText: We felt that the discussion had been very worthwhile.
ex.chText: 我们感到这次讨论很值得。
这是一项值得为之奋斗的事业。

ex.enText: It wasn't worthwhile to continue/continuing the project.
ex.chText: 继续这个项目很不值得。

tips.tip: 有时，worthwhile可分拆开来，中间插入所需要的物主代词。

ex.enText: This film is worth our while to see again.
ex.chText: 这部影片值得我们再看一遍。

synonyms.bx: 可作表语或定语，指某事物是值得的，或某事是值得花时间、金钱、精力做的，后接动词不定式和动名词均可。

ex.chText: 值得尊敬的冠军/对手/获胜者
崇高的目标/高尚的事业/有价值的生活
那是一项很有价值的工作。

ex.enText: The museum is worthy to be visited/of a visit/of being visited.
Local councillors thought that the program was worthy of support.
ex.chText: 当地政务委员们认为该规划值得支持。

synonyms.bx: 作定语时，主要用于修饰人或诸如事业、生活等抽象名词；作表语时，常后接被动语态的动词不定式，或介词 of 加名词或被动语态的动名词。

data.enText: for all sb/it is worth
with great energy, effort and determination
data.chText: 竭尽全力；拼命；十分坚定

data.enText: He was rowing for all he was worth.
data.chText: 他在拼命地划船。

data.enText: in order to get as much as you can from sb/sth
data.chText: 尽量（多得）；拼命（榨取）

data.enText: She is milking her success for all it's worth.
data.chText: 她在利用自己成功的机会拼命捞好处。

data.enText: for what it's worth
used to emphasize that what you are saying is only your own opinion or suggestion and may not be very helpful
data.chText: （所说的只是个人意见）无论管不管用，不论好坏

data.enText: I prefer this colour, for what it's worth.
data.chText: 无论好坏，我喜欢这个颜色。

data.enText: (the game is) not worth the candle
the advantages to be gained from doing sth are not great enough, considering the effort or cost involved
data.chText: 得不偿失；代价太高

data.enText: not worth the paper it's written/printed on
having no value, especially legally, or because one of the people involved has no intention of doing what they said they would
data.chText: （尤指在法律上）毫无价值

before.enText: of an agreement or official document

data.enText: worth your/its salt
deserving respect, especially because you do your job well
data.chText: 称职；胜任

data.enText: Any teacher worth her salt knows that.
data.chText: 凡称职的教师都知道这一点。

data.enText: worth your/its weight in gold
very useful or valuable
data.chText: 非常有用；很有价值

data.enText: A good mechanic is worth his weight in gold.
data.chText: 一位优秀的技工是不可多得的。

data.enText: worth sb's while
interesting or useful for sb to do
data.chText: 对…有好处（或用处）；值得

data.enText: It will be worth your while to come to the meeting.
data.chText: 你来参加会议对你会大有好处。

data.enText: He'll do the job if you make it worth his while (= pay him well) .
data.chText: 你要是给他的报酬丰厚，他会做这份工作的。

data.enText: a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush
it is better to keep sth that you already have than to risk losing it by trying to get much more
data.chText: 一鸟在手胜过双鸟在林（满足于现有的总比因过分追求而失去一切好）

data.enText: more than your job's worth (to do sth)
not worth doing because it is against the rules or because it might cause you to lose your job
data.chText: 工作所不允许的事；违反原则的事；可能丢饭碗的事

data.enText: It's more than my job's worth to let you in without a ticket.
data.chText: 没有票就让你进去，我可能会丢饭碗的。

data.enText: put in your two cents' worth

data.text: = put in your two pennyworth at pennyworth

data.enText: get your money's worth
to get enough value or enjoyment out of sth, considering the amount of money, time, etc. that you are spending on it
data.chText: （钱或时间等）值得花

tr: the quality that renders something desirable or valuable or useful
an indefinite quantity of something having a specified value

example.ex: These books might be worth £80 or £
example.tran: 90 or more to a collector... 这些书对收藏家而言可能值八九十英镑或更多。

example.ex: His mother inherited a farm worth 15,000 dollars a year...
example.tran: 他母亲继承了一处年产值为1.5万美元的农场。

example.ex: The contract was worth £25 million a year.
example.tran: 这份合同一年价值2,500万英镑。

value.def: If something is worth a particular amount of money, it can be sold for that amount or is considered to have that value.

example.ex: I went and bought about six dollars' worth of potato chips...
example.tran: 我去买了大约6美元的薯条。

example.ex: Large numbers of deer now roam the forests and are causing thousands of millions of roubles-worth of damage.
example.tran: 现在大批鹿群在森林里游荡，造成价值几十亿卢布的损失。

example.ex: 'How many do you want?' — 'I'll have a pound's worth.'
example.tran: “你要多少？”“我要1英镑的。”

value.def: Worth combines with amounts of money, so that when you talk about a particular amount of money's worth of something, you mean the quantity of it that you can buy for that amount of money.

example.ex: You've got three years' worth of research money to do what you want with...
example.tran: 你有可维持3年的研究经费去做自己想做的事。

example.ex: After an hour and a quarter's-worth of cleansing, toning and pampering, the difference to the way my skin felt was remarkable.
example.tran: 经过1小时15分钟的清洁、柔肤和精心护理后，我的皮肤摸上去感觉大不一样。

example.ex: There's really not very much food down there. About two weeks' worth.
example.tran: 那儿真的没多少吃的了，大概能维持两个星期。

value.def: Worth combines with time expressions, so you can use worth when you are saying how long an amount of something will last. For example, a week's worth of food is the amount of food that will last you for a week.

example.ex: He's decided to get a look at the house and see if it might be worth buying...
example.tran: 他决定去瞧瞧那座房子，看是否值得买下。

example.ex: If this was what his job required, then the job wasn't really worth having...
example.tran: 如果这是他的工作所需，那么这份工作真的不值得去做。

example.ex: Most things worth having never come easy.
example.tran: 大部分值得拥有的东西都来之不易。

value.def: If you say that something is worth having, you mean that it is pleasant or useful, and therefore a good thing to have.

example.ex: No one is worth a great deal of sacrifice...
example.tran: 没有谁值得付出重大的牺牲。

example.ex: I am spending a lot of money and time on this boat, but it is worth it...
example.tran: 我在这艘船上花了很多金钱和时间，但都很值得。

example.ex: This restaurant is well worth a visit...
example.tran: 这家饭店非常值得光顾一番。

example.ex: It is worth pausing to consider these statements from Mr Davies.
example.tran: 戴维斯先生的这番话值得大家停下来思考一下。

value.def: If something is worth a particular action, or if an action is worth doing, it is considered to be important enough for that action.
value.tran: 具有(某一行动)的价值;值得(做)

example.ex: He had never had a woman of her worth as a friend...
example.tran: 他从来没有过像她这样值得交往的女性朋友。

example.ex: The team would have need of a driver of his worth.
example.tran: 这支队伍需要一位他这样技术水平的司机。

value.def: Someone's worth is the value, usefulness, or importance that they are considered to have.

example.ex: We both began waving to the crowd for all we were worth...
example.tran: 我们俩开始使劲地朝人群挥手。

example.ex: Push for all you're worth!
example.tran: 使足劲推！

value.def: If you do something for all you are worth, you do it with a lot of energy and enthusiasm.
value.tran: 拼命地; 全力以赴地；热情高涨地

example.ex: You get anywhere with legal aid only by playing the system for all it is worth.
example.tran: 你若想让法律援助多少发挥点作用，只有充分利用这一制度。

example.ex: ...taking an idea and exploiting it for all it's worth.
example.tran: 选取一种观点并对其充分加以挖掘

value.def: If someone does something for all it is worth, they do it as much as possible and for as long as they can get benefit from it.
value.tran: 尽可能地利用;充分利用

example.ex: For what it's worth, my feeling is that ice in whisky is fine...
example.tran: 不管怎么样，我觉得威士忌放冰很好。

example.ex: I've brought my notes, for what it's worth.
example.tran: 不管有没有用，我反正把我的笔记带来了。

value.def: If you add for what it's worth to something that you say, you are suggesting that what you are saying or referring to may not be very valuable or helpful, especially because you do not want to appear arrogant.
value.tran: (尤为避免显得傲慢)不管好坏，不管有没有用

example.ex: It might be worth your while to go to court and ask for the agreement to be changed...
example.tran: 上法庭要求对协议进行改动也许对你有益。

example.ex: You'll find it well worth your while to learn something of each island's special features before visiting them.
example.tran: 你会发现游览之前先了解一下各岛的特色非常有帮助。

value.def: If an action or activity is worth someone's while, it will be helpful, useful, or enjoyable for them if they do it, even though it requires some effort.
value.tran: (行为或活动)值得…去做，对…有好处
